result.execSummary:
The defendant Lary D Hudson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine, costs and payment plan fee shall be paid at a rate of $50 per month commencing 1-15-16 and the 15th of each month thereafter until paid in full or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.
Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Sheriff's Department for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.
There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

defendant.name: Hudson, Lary D

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

Def in person & by Atty Julie Ann Maule.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Resolution reached; fine recommended.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 1 and imposes a fine of $479 plus the $200 DNA surcharge to be paid at a rate of $50 per month commencing  1-15-16 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.  DNA sample ordered.  12-07-15 Jury trial removed from Court's calendar.  Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Sheriff's Department for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.  Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.

Jury status hearing at 11-18-2015 09:45 am.
Jury trial at 12-07-2015 08:30 am.

Def in person & by Atty Julie Ann Maule.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Not guilty plea entered.  One day jury trial requested.  Jury trial scheduled for December 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings
Def in person & by Atty Julie Ann Maule.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Court withdraws stayed capias and bail forfeiture.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Atty Julie A. Maule appearing for Def.  Atty Peter Cannon for State. Defendant is participating in inpatient treatment. Capias & Bail Forfeiture ordered - stayed until adj. date.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #108666 on 7/12/15; COC Rec#15R 014688 dated 7/17/15
Absolute sobriety; No violent contact with NH or BLH; Take prescribed medications

Def appeared in person.  Atty Peter John Cannon for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  $150 cash bond continued.  Defendant to see SPD and info. given.  Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
